text: Focus on the basics before trying anything else. Really understand the principles and start layering them in simple exercises, I see a lot of reels where people try to emulate other peoples work without having the basics down, and the work suffers for it.
Ok then, how about I start with a simple walking exercise?

I'd say you can go simpler Nana, I'd suggest you start with a bouncing ball on the spot, make it a rubber ball with nice bounce and have it loop. Next you can try the same type of ball but bouncing past the screen until it loses momentum and stops.
You can then try different types of balls, a bowling ball, a beach ball, they will all make you think differently about how they'd work and move differently.
you can download and use this free rig - <https://www.bloopanimation.com/ball-rig/>

attachments.title: Ultimate Ball Rig: A Free Squash and Stretch Scalable Bouncing Ball Rig (For Maya)
attachments.text: A free to download scalable bouncing ball rig for Maya with flexible squash and stretch controls. The ultimate ball rig for animation exercises.
